channel.title: Mac NPC spawning/walking
channel.description:
Alright, so i have been spending the past 2 days trying to figure this out, looking at tutorials and other things.
One thing i found common was that most tutorials were windows. Also I am not looking to publicize my server just yet, until i can actually code right. This basically means that i am not needing a no ip and all that stuff. I have just downloaded moparscape and run the moparscape.jar to actually run the source and client.
Alright from their I am a mac user, so when i open my autospawn it says choose an app. So from looking around using a notepad or something different is what you need, so i used textedit which is basically the same. So i get the codes for all the spawns already. Most tutorials say before the [endofspawnlist] put your spawn, which is normally at the bottom of the list. Mine doesn't have that. Also make sure it lines up with the other codes, which some numbers do but some don't for me. I don't think this really matters though.
Alright then i find my coordinates on the game doing ::mypos and sub them into the textedit of autospawn. Once everything was complete I save it and then logout and in. But nothing is there. Yes i know as a window user you should have a compiler to do that, but with mac what and how do i do it.
I have checked the mac help tutorial on moparscape but as i am relatively new i need more help into doing this.
Help would be much appreciated. :)

item.title: Mac NPC spawning/walking
item.dc:creator: @gilbo184 gilbo184
item.description:
@gilbo184 wrote:

Unfortunately, It seems something isn’t right.

Lets make this clear for the 10th time.

Download moparscape on what ever ‘here’ near mac (I am a mac user)

Open moparscape.jar to run the game.

Get on the game and get the coordinates for the npc spawn.

Go on autospawn and type them at the top before the guide things.

Then quit the game (sever altogether)

Save the autospawn (I am using ‘textedit’ to open autospawn if that really matters.)

Open the game again and go on to find no npc.

Now help. :S

Read full topic

Are you still stuck or what?

If you can help me do this you would be regarded as the biggest helper i have ever met on the internet. You know i am a rs veteran and a lot of people have helped.

+Also don’t i need to download a c/c++ or what ever it is or doesn’t matter? not to sure. :P[/quote]
Sorry i dont work with Eclipse xD google One second i’ll pm you a guide

item.title: Mac NPC spawning/walking
item.dc:creator: @xXSh0ckXx xXSh0ckXx
item.description:
@xXSh0ckXx wrote:

[quote=“gilbo184, post:17, topic:518023”]Please help instead of dissing.

Yes right now mac sucks but i know i can do this. :)[/quote]
Look i try to help you

Download Eclipse Simple answer mate

http://www.eclipse.org/downloads/ When you are working with an IDE you dont need to compile

  • Dont worry about that [ENDOFSPAWNLIST] Thing. Everything is the same, the text “ENDOFSPAWNLIST” is not required to end the spawn list at your source
    No problem, if you continue have questions just pm me

Read full topic

so you see the autospawn. I will add the npc blah blah at the top after the guide things at the top top then i will save it by just going command s or file/save and then start the server. item.description:
@gilbo184 wrote:

Hey mate

I am not sure how to compile and i will add images of the files. I am pretty sure there is no compiler command. Also teach me how to create. You might be a window user but try your best.

First when i open moparscape after unzipping it.

Then into ‘Aryan.’

then into ‘Hybridscape.’

Basically they are all the files that are important. So what now?

Also look at this is this right?

At the bottom of the autosapwn there is no [ENDOFSPAWNLIST]:

Also this is at the top of autospawn.

Read full topic

item.title: Mac NPC spawning/walking
item.dc:creator: @xXSh0ckXx xXSh0ckXx
item.description:
@xXSh0ckXx wrote:

[quote=“gilbo184, post:9, topic:518023”]Did that but it still didn’t work.

I quit the whole server (moparscape) and then went onto the autospawn file and did all the things. Then saved it and started the server. Still no npc. ???[/quote]
Hello mate! It’s me again
I recommend you download another source, then try compiling there. If still doesnt work, try (I think its called .command at linux) making a file called “compiler.command” and then just copy the codes from another compiler

If that doesnt work too, then i cant help you sorry :S

item.dc:creator: @sk8rdude461 sk8rdude461
item.description:
@sk8rdude461 wrote:

gilbo184:

The thing is i don’t know how to compile on mac right. I must be doing something wrong. Help

Mac’s can be compiled with shell files, can’t they?

gilbo184:

so i just log out from my server and do the adding do spawn then save and log in and it should be there. No compiling needed?

You shut off the server, edit & save. Then run.

item.title: Mac NPC spawning/walking
item.dc:creator: @xXSh0ckXx xXSh0ckXx
item.description:
@xXSh0ckXx wrote:

Lin:

Make sure your server is closed, edit the file, save it, then restart your server. There is no difference in the server you’re using between Windows and Mac.

Well, I have another method…

Edit files, Close server, Compile

Good night, gtg sleeping now

Read full topic
